translated: The ninth sign is the realization that all things are empty, and that although things are the same in being dependent on the object of adherence, there is a distinction between affliction and purification.üîΩThe verse says,

original: dper na sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dper na sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, for example, Buddha, etc.

original: sprul pa de byed pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa na ste rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa med par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sprul pa de byed pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa na ste rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa med par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The agent of that emanation is called an agent when there is no conceptualizing consciousness.

original: bya ba'i 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa ni de bsal bas shing gi 'khrul 'khor bzhin du rang gi bya ba'i 'bras bu thams cad mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba'i 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa ni de bsal bas shing gi 'khrul 'khor bzhin du rang gi bya ba'i 'bras bu thams cad mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: The conceptualization of the result of action is refuted by that. In order to establish that all the results of one's actions are accomplished like a wooden machine,

original: shing mkhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: shing mkhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: he says, for example, carpenter, etc.

original: shing mkhan zhes bya ba ni 'khrul 'khor mkhan no //
analyzed: shing mkhan zhes bya ba ni 'khrul 'khor mkhan no //
translated: Carpenter means a machine maker.

original: bzo bo zhes bya ba ni rang gi bya ba la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: bzo bo zhes bya ba ni rang gi bya ba la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Craftsman means skilled in one's work.

original: mkhas pa des zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i sgyu rtsal la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa des zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i sgyu rtsal la mkhas pa ste /
translated: That skilled one, etc. means skilled in the arts other than that.

original: gzhan gyis ni de lta bu'i 'khrul 'khor grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni de lta bu'i 'khrul 'khor grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not the case that the machine is not constructed by another.

original: skyes pa bud med dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med lta bu zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: skyes pa bud med dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med lta bu zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: Like a man or a woman means like a man or a woman.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni bya ba nar ma'i 'bras bu la rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni bya ba nar ma'i 'bras bu la rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is nonconceptual because it is not conceptualized as the effect of a prior action.

original: gal te 'o na ni bya ba la 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'o na ni bya ba la 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: But if it does not engage in action,

original: de ni rnam par rtog pa la rag las pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa la rag las pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: it is not a man or a woman, because it is dependent on conceptualization.

original: nyes pa med de 'khrul 'khor bzhin du yod pa tsam gyis de la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa med de 'khrul 'khor bzhin du yod pa tsam gyis de la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no fault, because it engages in action merely by existing, like a machine.

original: de la ni rgyu bzo byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa yod pas 'di ni de dang mi 'dra'o snyam du yang dogs par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de la ni rgyu bzo byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa yod pas 'di ni de dang mi 'dra'o snyam du yang dogs par mi bya ste /
translated: But do not suppose that this is not like that, because the conceptualization that creates the machine exists.

original: 'di la yang sngon gyi smon lam gyi 'phen pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la yang sngon gyi smon lam gyi 'phen pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the prior aspiration exists in this case.

original: rnam par rtog pa la yang rang yod pa tsam gtogs pa byed pa gzhan ni med pa kho na yin la de ni 'di dang yang khyad par med do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la yang rang yod pa tsam gtogs pa byed pa gzhan ni med pa kho na yin la de ni 'di dang yang khyad par med do //
translated: And in the case of conceptualization, there is no other activity except the mere presence of itself, and that is no different from this.

original: shin tu goms pa dang ldan pa rnams la rgyu rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa med par kha ton la sogs pa'i bya ba 'jug pa dag 'byung ba yang mthong ste mang du mi dgos so //
analyzed: shin tu goms pa dang ldan pa rnams la rgyu rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa med par kha ton la sogs pa'i bya ba 'jug pa dag 'byung ba yang mthong ste mang du mi dgos so //
translated: And it is seen that for those who are very well habituated, the activity of recitation, etc. occurs without the cause, the conceptual consciousness, and there is no need for many.

original: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i spyod pa'i phan @169b yon ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i spyod pa'i phan @169b yon ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Thus, the benefits of the practice of nonconceptuality are threefold:

original: bkur sti phun sum tshogs pa ni brgya byin la sogs pa thams cad kyis phyag byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bkur sti phun sum tshogs pa ni brgya byin la sogs pa thams cad kyis phyag byas pa'i phyir /
translated: The perfection of respect is because all, such as Indra, bow down to him.

original: de ltar spyod mkhas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar spyod mkhas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the verse beginning ‚ÄúSkilled in the practice‚Äù occurs.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dgongs pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis de'i yon tan brjod pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dgongs pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis de'i yon tan brjod pa'i phyir ;
translated: The intention of all the Buddhas is because all the Buddhas proclaim his good qualities.

original: phyogs bcu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the verse beginning ‚ÄúIn the ten directions‚Äù occurs.

original: bar chad byed pa med pa nyid ni bdud thams cad kyis kyang bar chad bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bar chad byed pa med pa nyid ni bdud thams cad kyis kyang bar chad bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: The absence of any obstruction is because all demons cannot create an obstruction.

original: gang g'a'i klung mnyam zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: gang g'a'i klung mnyam zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The passage beginning ‚Äúequal to the Ganges river sands‚Äù occurs.

original: 'di skad du gal te 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na yod pa'i sems cad rnams bdud du gyur la bdud re res kyang ba spyi'i bu ga re re nas byung ba'i bdud kyi lus kyi tshad de snyed cig sprul du zin kyang 'on kyang byang chub sems
analyzed: 'di skad du gal te 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na yod pa'i sems cad rnams bdud du gyur la bdud re res kyang ba spyi'i bu ga re re nas byung ba'i bdud kyi lus kyi tshad de snyed cig sprul du zin kyang 'on kyang byang chub sems
translated: This is saying that if all sentient beings in all world systems were to become demons, and if each demon were to emanate as many demon bodies as there are pores on the body of each one, still they would not be able to obstruct the bodhisattva

original: dpa' rnam par mi rtog par spyod pa la bar chad bya mi nus so zhes bshad dpa yin no //üîΩde nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dpa' rnam par mi rtog par spyod pa la bar chad bya mi nus so zhes bshad dpa yin no // de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: who practices nonconceptually.

original: rgyu rnam bzhis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyu rnam bzhis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to clarify that, it says, ‚Äúdue to four reasons.‚Äù

original: rgyu ba ba zhi las stong pa nyid la rnam par gnas pa ni chos bdag med pa rtogs par bdud kyi sprul pa'i yul gyi nye bar spyad pa dpe med pa dag la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ba ba zhi las stong pa nyid la rnam par gnas pa ni chos bdag med pa rtogs par bdud kyi sprul pa'i yul gyi nye bar spyad pa dpe med pa dag la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who is engaged in the emptiness of the pacification of the subject does not settle down in the objects of the magical emanations of Mara, which are incomparable in their service, because he has realized the selflessness of phenomena.

original: sems can thams cad kyis mi gtong ba nyid ni snying rjes sems can la lta ba dang bcas pa 'gro ba mi mthun pa mthong ba las yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis mi gtong ba nyid ni snying rjes sems can la lta ba dang bcas pa 'gro ba mi mthun pa mthong ba las yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is not abandoned by all beings because, with his compassion, he does not actualize the limit of reality, seeing that beings are in a state of disagreement.

original: dam bcas pa bstan pa nyid ni ji skad du smras pa de bzhin byed pas le lo med pa bya ba thams cad la bar chad med par rab tu sbyor pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam bcas pa bstan pa nyid ni ji skad du smras pa de bzhin byed pas le lo med pa bya ba thams cad la bar chad med par rab tu sbyor pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is not lazy because he is not interrupted in all his activities, as he does what he says he will do.

original: sangs rgyas kyis dgongs pa nyid ni tshogs sogs pas bde bar gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i sbyor ba 'bras bu yod par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis dgongs pa nyid ni tshogs sogs pas bde bar gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i sbyor ba 'bras bu yod par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is approved by the Buddha because his practice, being endowed with the accumulations, is blessed by the Sugata and becomes fruitful.

original: bde gshegs byin rlabs can zhes bya ba ni gang la rten bde bar gshegs pa kho na'i byin gyi rlabs yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: bde gshegs byin rlabs can zhes bya ba ni gang la rten bde bar gshegs pa kho na'i byin gyi rlabs yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: The one called ‚Äúblessed by the Sugata‚Äù is so called because he has the blessing of the Sugata himself.

original: thams cad du yang shes rab kho na gtso bo yin pas de la mos pa sngon du 'gro ba'i rab tu 'jug pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad du yang shes rab kho na gtso bo yin pas de la mos pa sngon du 'gro ba'i rab tu 'jug pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Since wisdom is foremost in all cases, the engagement that is preceded by the aspiration for that is the perfection of the accumulation for omniscience.

original: de zhin gshegs yum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩthams cad mkhyen pa nyid la zhugs zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi @170a * //
analyzed: de zhin gshegs yum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la zhugs zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi @170a * //
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚Äúthe mother of the Tathagatas,‚Äù and so on.üîΩ‚ÄúEngaged in omniscience‚Äù means that all those who possess the practice of the perfection of wisdom are exclusively devoted to omniscience.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa dang ldan pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gcig tu gzhol ba yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa dang ldan pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gcig tu gzhol ba yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: gal te thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la zhugs na 'o na ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pa yin rang gi lam gyi 'bras bu la rnam par rtog pa med pa ni de la 'jug pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la zhugs na 'o na ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pa yin rang gi lam gyi 'bras bu la rnam par rtog pa med pa ni de la 'jug pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: If one enters into omniscience, then how is it non-conceptual? It is not tenable to enter into the result of one's own path without conceptualizing it.

original: de'i lan gdab par chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i lan gdab par chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To answer that, he says the realm of phenomena, etc.

original: stobs la sogs pa'i chos kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir chos dbyings so //
analyzed: stobs la sogs pa'i chos kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir chos dbyings so //
translated: The realm of phenomena is so called because it is the cause of the phenomena of the powers, etc.

original: dus thams cad du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid de stong ba nyid de ni rtog tu de kho na bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid de stong ba nyid de ni rtog tu de kho na bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Suchness is so called because it is emptiness, unchanging at all times.üîΩIt does not abide means it does not abide by the nature of clinging to it.

original: gnas par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de la yang mngon par zhen pa'i bdag nyid kyis gnas par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: gnas par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de la yang mngon par zhen pa'i bdag nyid kyis gnas par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This is what is meant by the phrase, ‚ÄúIt does not abide.‚Äù

original: de la mngon par zhen pa ni phyin ci log pa nyid kyis de la gnas pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen pa ni phyin ci log pa nyid kyis de la gnas pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Clinging to it is not the nature of abiding in it because it is erroneous.

original: de lta bas na gnas pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na gnas pa med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it does not abide.

original: mngon par zhe na med pa kho na gnas pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: mngon par zhe na med pa kho na gnas pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: One who is utterly non-abiding is said to be ‚Äúdwelling.‚Äù

original: de bzhin nyid la gnas pa yin no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la gnas pa yin no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The context is that one dwells in suchness.

original: bar snang la sprin dang rig sngags 'chang ba dang 'dra bas /
analyzed: bar snang la sprin dang rig sngags 'chang ba dang 'dra bas /
translated: Like a cloud in the sky or a knowledge-mantra-holder,

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: for example,üîΩa cloud in the sky,

original: gnas med ces bya ba ni khyim med pa'o /
analyzed: gnas med ces bya ba ni khyim med pa'o /
translated: though it has no abode,

original: gnas 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni gnas mngon par bsgrub par 'dod pas te /
analyzed: gnas 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni gnas mngon par bsgrub par 'dod pas te /
translated: wishes for an abode,

original: 'di skad du dper na rig sngags 'chang bar snang la rgyu ba gnas mngon par bsgrub par 'dod na nam mkha' kho na la dus ma yin par me tog dang 'bras bu dang lo ma dang ldan pa'i shing gi skyed mos tshal la sogs pa byin gyis rlob
analyzed: 'di skad du dper na rig sngags 'chang bar snang la rgyu ba gnas mngon par bsgrub par 'dod na nam mkha' kho na la dus ma yin par me tog dang 'bras bu dang lo ma dang ldan pa'i shing gi skyed mos tshal la sogs pa byin gyis rlob
translated: and when it wishes to create an abode, it creates a park with untimely flowers, fruits, and leaves in the sky itself.

original: par byed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa yang rang dang gzhan gyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i rten gyi mchog yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: par byed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa yang rang dang gzhan gyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i rten gyi mchog yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Just as a mirror is the supreme basis for the appearance of all forms, so too the bodhisattva who abides in emptiness by way of nonapprehending is the supreme basis for the perfection of his own and others' aims.

original: gal te de lta na de bzhin nyid la mi gnas pa yin pas de ji ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis de rtogs nas dag pa 'jig rten pa'i gnas skabs na gzhan dag la ston par byed ces ce na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na de bzhin nyid la mi gnas pa yin pas de ji ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis de rtogs nas dag pa 'jig rten pa'i gnas skabs na gzhan dag la ston par byed ces ce na /
translated: If that is so, then since he does not abide in suchness, how does he realize it by means of the supramundane path and then teach it to others in the pure mundane state?

original: de'i lan gdab par de ltar spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i lan gdab par de ltar spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To answer that, he says, thus practicing, etc.

analyzed: rtogs par byed pa ni khong du chud par byed pa'o //
translated: Realizing means comprehending.

original: sangs rgyas chos rnams ni stobs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos rnams ni stobs la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: dmigs mi 'gyur @170b zhes bya ba ni dmigs par mi byed pa ste /

analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnas skabs na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the supramundane state, means in the pure mundane state.

original: chos 'dod lta bar byed ces bya ba ni tshig dang don 'dzin par nus pa'i nyan pa po ste mi dmigs zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos 'dod lta bar byed ces bya ba ni tshig dang don 'dzin par nus pa'i nyan pa po ste mi dmigs zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //

analyzed: zhi 'dod ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi sgrib pa spang bar 'dod pa rnams so //

original: de nyid kyi khyad par ni yon tan dga' zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khyad par ni yon tan dga' zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The distinction of that is ‚Äúone who delights in virtue.‚Äù

analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa 'dod pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one who desires the perfection of intuition.

original: 'di ni gnas pa yin zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis gang zag la sogs pa mi dmigs pa kho na rtog pa thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa nyid kyis mthong ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid dang de'i rjes la thob pa ni gnas pa
analyzed: 'di ni gnas pa yin zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis gang zag la sogs pa mi dmigs pa kho na rtog pa thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa nyid kyis mthong ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid dang de'i rjes la thob pa ni gnas pa
translated: This is the station. In the manner explained, only the non-apprehension of the person, etc. is the antidote to all conceptualization, and thus it is the path of insight and the attainment subsequent to it.

analyzed: yin te / chog tu rab tu dga' ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the station because it is the cause of the highest joy.

translated: It is said, The bodhisattva who... and so on.

original: skye med ces bya ba ni gang zhig gis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la skye ba med pa nyid dang 'di nyid la zad pa med pa nyid du shes rab 'di shes pa de ni rang byung thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: skye med ces bya ba ni gang zhig gis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la skye ba med pa nyid dang 'di nyid la zad pa med pa nyid du shes rab 'di shes pa de ni rang byung thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Non-arising is the wisdom that knows that dependent origination is non-arising and that this very [dependent origination] is non-exhaustion. One who knows this wisdom attains self-arising.

original: gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not otherwise,

original: ma rig pa'i ling tog gis bsgribs pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i ling tog gis bsgribs pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: because it is obscured by the cataract of ignorance.

original: bcom nas zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa'i thibs po bsal nas te /
analyzed: bcom nas zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa'i thibs po bsal nas te /
translated: Having destroyed means having removed the darkness of ignorance, which is the counteragent to all perfections,

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo spyod yul du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo spyod yul du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the essence of suchness becomes the object-field.

original: gal te ji ltar na shes rab tsam gyis pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs spongs she na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar na shes rab tsam gyis pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs spongs she na /
translated: If one asks how wisdom alone removes the counteragents to the other perfections,

original: shes rab de ni de bzhin nyid kyi yul can yin pas thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes rab de ni de bzhin nyid kyi yul can yin pas thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: it is because that wisdom, having suchness as its object, is the antidote to all [counteragents].

original: 'khor gsum mi dmigs pa med par sbyin pa la sogs pas ser sna la sogs pa skye ba'i rgyu rtog pa bsal bar ni mi nus so //
analyzed: 'khor gsum mi dmigs pa med par sbyin pa la sogs pas ser sna la sogs pa skye ba'i rgyu rtog pa bsal bar ni mi nus so //
translated: Without the non-apprehension of the three sectors, one cannot eliminate the conceptualization which is the cause of the arising of stinginess, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na de dag la pha rol tu phyin pa zhes tha snyad mi gdags so //üîΩshes rab dam pas rab tu phye ba'i sbyin pa @174a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na de dag la pha rol tu phyin pa zhes tha snyad mi gdags so // shes rab dam pas rab tu phye ba'i sbyin pa @174a * //
translated: Therefore, they are not designated as perfections.

original: la sogs pa ni skad cig ma gcig la yang pha rol tu phyin pa ril gyis tha snyad rten te /
analyzed: la sogs pa ni skad cig ma gcig la yang pha rol tu phyin pa ril gyis tha snyad rten te /
translated: The giving, etc. which are distinguished by the highest wisdom are designated as perfections in one moment,

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / thams cad kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / thams cad kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the characteristics of all the perfections and because they eliminate the resistances of all the perfections.

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i sems kyi skad cig kho na la sems can rnams la byams pa'i phyir tshul khrims yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i sems kyi skad cig kho na la sems can rnams la byams pa'i phyir tshul khrims yin no //
translated: Thus, in the very moment of the thought of giving, there is morality, because of the love for sentient beings.

original: len pa po gshe ba la sogs pa'i bzod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bzod pa yin no //
analyzed: len pa po gshe ba la sogs pa'i bzod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bzod pa yin no //
translated: There is patience, because of the characteristic of patience with the abuse of the recipients, etc.

original: 'gro ba bskyab pa la spro ba'i phyir brtson 'grus yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba bskyab pa la spro ba'i phyir brtson 'grus yin no //
translated: There is effort, because of the enthusiasm for the protection of the world.

original: byang chub gzhan yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub gzhan yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are not distracted by attending to other vehicles.

original: bsam gtan yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan yin no //
translated: It is concentration because it is not distracted by attention to other enlightenments.

original: sgyu ma lta bu la sogs par so sor rtog pa'i phyir shes rab yin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu la sogs par so sor rtog pa'i phyir shes rab yin no //
translated: It is wisdom because it discriminates the illusion-like nature of things.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa'i sems kyi skad cig la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa'i sems kyi skad cig la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Similarly, it should be applied to the momentariness of morality, etc.

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa la ni byams pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las nye bar gnas par 'gyur zhes bya ba nas ;
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa la ni byams pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las nye bar gnas par 'gyur zhes bya ba nas ;
translated: Subhuti, here, when a bodhisattva gives a gift, the action of his body, speech, and mind, which is motivated by love, is present.

original: de ltar na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug car yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug car yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, while standing in the perfection of giving, he fulfills all six perfections.

original: 'dis ni mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma gcig yin par bstan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma gcig yin par bstan par rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood as the teaching that the path of insight has a single moment.

original: sems kyi skad cig kho na la pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan thams cad mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig kho na la pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan thams cad mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in a single moment of mind, he actualizes all the qualities of the perfections.

original: gal te 'o na ni rab tu dga' ba'i gnas skabs kho nar pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i phyir sa gzhan de dag don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na ni rab tu dga' ba'i gnas skabs kho nar pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i phyir sa gzhan de dag don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If, in that case, the other stages would be pointless, because the perfections are purified just in the Joyous stage.

original: bden te sa thams cad ni mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnas skabs la ltos na khyad par ci yang med do //
analyzed: bden te sa thams cad ni mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnas skabs la ltos na khyad par ci yang med do //
translated: It is true that all the stages are not different at all in the supramundane state, because they have the same nature.

original: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i gnas skabs pa'i yon tan ni kha cig mthong ba'i skad cig mas bsgrub par bya ba yin la kha cig ni bsgom pas bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i gnas skabs pa'i yon tan ni kha cig mthong ba'i skad cig mas bsgrub par bya ba yin la kha cig ni bsgom pas bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: But some of the qualities in the mundane state of purity are to be achieved by the moment of seeing, and some are to be achieved by the path of meditation.

original: sa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa yang de la ltos pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa yang de la ltos pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: And the classification of the stages is established in dependence on them.

original: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid kyi mthong ba'i lam las ji ltar mthong ba goms pa'i ngo bo nyid bsgom pa'i lam 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid kyi mthong ba'i lam las ji ltar mthong ba goms pa'i ngo bo nyid bsgom pa'i lam 'byung ngo //
translated: The path of cultivation arises from the path of seeing, which has the nature of the vision of reality, and has the nature of the familiarization with what has been seen.

original: de yang mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be understood that it has the characteristic of non-attachment even in the state of meditative equipoise,

original: bsam gtan la @174b sogs pa la gnas kyang de kho na nyid mthong ba'i stobs kyis de la mi gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam gtan la @174b sogs pa la gnas kyang de kho na nyid mthong ba'i stobs kyis de la mi gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: because even though one abides in the meditative concentrations and so forth, one does not abide in them by the power of seeing reality.

original: mthu chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mthu chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse begins, The one of great power...

original: mthu chen zhes bya ba ni lugs dang mthun pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis bsam gtan dang po la sogs pas gnas par nus pa'o //
analyzed: mthu chen zhes bya ba ni lugs dang mthun pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis bsam gtan dang po la sogs pas gnas par nus pa'o //
translated: The one of great power is able to abide in the first meditative concentration and so forth in the forward order and so on.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po ni dge ba rtse gcig pa 'dod khams kyi gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po ni dge ba rtse gcig pa 'dod khams kyi gnyen po yin no //
translated: The first meditative concentration is the antidote to the desire realm.

original: gnyis pa ni spyod pa'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni spyod pa'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: The second is the antidote to conduct.

original: gsum pa ni yid bde ba'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni yid bde ba'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: The third is the antidote to mental pleasure.

original: bzhi pa ni bde ba'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni bde ba'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: The fourth is the antidote to pleasure.

original: bsam gtan bzhi po 'di dag dang / gzugs med pa nam mkha' mtha' yas la sogs pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag gis te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi po 'di dag dang / gzugs med pa nam mkha' mtha' yas la sogs pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag gis te /
translated: These four meditative concentrations and the formless states of the sphere of infinite space and so on, as well as the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig to mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig to mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can
translated: Subh≈´ti, here bodhisattva great beings, isolated from desires, isolated from negative and nonvirtuous factors, endowed with ideation and scrutiny, and with the joy and bliss born of isolation,

original: bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: perfect and dwell in the first meditative concentration.

original: de bzhin du 'du byed dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du byed dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: Similarly, they perfect and dwell in the meditative attainment of the cessation of ideation and sensation.

original: de 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las langs te 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go zhes bya ba'i bar gang rgyas par gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: de 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las langs te 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go zhes bya ba'i bar gang rgyas par gsungs pa yin no /
translated: Rising from the meditative attainment of cessation, they enter the meditative attainment of the sphere of neither ideation nor nonideation.

original: // / bam po drug pa /
analyzed: // / bam po drug pa /
translated: This is what is extensively taught.

original: rten pa zhes bya ba ni gzung bar rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rten pa zhes bya ba ni gzung bar rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The support is the discrimination of the apprehended object.

original: gnas pa ni 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa ste der mi byed pa ni bsgom pa'i lam rtog pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa ni 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa ste der mi byed pa ni bsgom pa'i lam rtog pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The abiding is the discrimination of the apprehending subject. Not doing that means not doing that, because the path of meditative development is the counteragent to all the aspects of conceptual differentiation.

original: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyis skye ba'i bsam gtan la 'dod chags dang bral na 'o na de la gnas ci dgos she na /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyis skye ba'i bsam gtan la 'dod chags dang bral na 'o na de la gnas ci dgos she na /
translated: If one is free from attachment to the meditative development of the non-discriminative, what need is there to abide in that?

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩ'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir / 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:üîΩbut...

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni de lta mod kyi'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni de lta mod kyi'o //
translated: but means nevertheless;

original: bsam gtan 'du shes zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan rnams 'du shes tsam gyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam gtan 'du shes zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan rnams 'du shes tsam gyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: the meditative development of the notion of the meditative concentrations refers to the meditative development of the notion that the meditative concentrations are characterized by mere conceptual differentiation.

original: kha cig las ni bsam gtan yan lag bcas pa zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: kha cig las ni bsam gtan yan lag bcas pa zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In some sources, it is described as the meditative development of the meditative concentrations together with their members.

original: der ni rab tu dang ba la sogs pa'i yan lag dang bcas par 'dug pas na bsam gtan yan lag dang bcas pa rnams so zhes @175a * //
analyzed: der ni rab tu dang ba la sogs pa'i yan lag dang bcas par 'dug pas na bsam gtan yan lag dang bcas pa rnams so zhes @175a * //
translated: There, the meditative development of the meditative concentrations together with their members refers to the meditative development of the meditative concentrations together with the members such as the absence of passion, because one abides in the meditative concentrations together with their members. The meditative development of the notion of the meditative concentrations refers to the meditative development of the notion that the meditative concentrations are characterized by mere conceptual differentiation.

original: bya bar blta'o //
analyzed: bya bar blta'o //
translated: One should see it as an action.

original: des ni 'di skad du rnam par mi rtog bzhin du de ltar bsam gtan la sogs pas gnas pa gang yin pa de ni de lta bu'i sems bskyed pa brgyud pas rdzogs pa'i byang chub bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des ni 'di skad du rnam par mi rtog bzhin du de ltar bsam gtan la sogs pas gnas pa gang yin pa de ni de lta bu'i sems bskyed pa brgyud pas rdzogs pa'i byang chub bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being said: ‚ÄúThat which is the abiding in meditative stabilization, etc., while not conceptualizing is the perfection of enlightenment, since it is perfected by the continuum of the generation of the thought of enlightenment.‚Äù

original: bsgom pa'i lam bshad zin to /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam bshad zin to /
translated: The path of cultivation has been explained.

original: // / de mchog tu gyur pa ni bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtha' ste /
analyzed: // / de mchog tu gyur pa ni bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtha' ste /
translated: The supreme of those is the end of the uninterrupted meditative stabilization.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sgom pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin kho na yin pa'i phyir de bstan pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sgom pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin kho na yin pa'i phyir de bstan pa /
translated: Since the vajra-like meditative stabilization of the bodhisattva‚Äôs cultivation is just that, it is taught.

original: shes rab mchog thob ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: shes rab mchog thob ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Obtaining the supreme wisdom, etc.

original: shes rab mchog thob ces bya ba ni sa chen po'i gnas skabs na thob pa'i shes rab mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab mchog thob ces bya ba ni sa chen po'i gnas skabs na thob pa'i shes rab mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa'o //
translated: Obtaining the supreme wisdom is the signless spontaneous wisdom obtained in the state of the great stage.

original: bsam gtan dag la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsam gtan bzhi la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dag la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsam gtan bzhi la gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding in the meditative concentrations refers to abiding in the four meditative concentrations that have just been explained.

original: gzugs med ting 'dzin dam pa bzhi yang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bzhi yang nyams su myong ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzugs med ting 'dzin dam pa bzhi yang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bzhi yang nyams su myong ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: And the four formless states of composure refers to the four formless states of composure that have the sphere of infinite space, etc., as their essential nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar bsam gtan 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam gtan 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúBecause these meditative states are beneficial for the attainment of supreme enlightenment.‚Äù

original: bsam gtan bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub dam pa mchog ste go rims bzhin du ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dam pa dang mchog gi khyad par du 'phags pa'i rdzogs pa'i byang chub la phan pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub dam pa mchog ste go rims bzhin du ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dam pa dang mchog gi khyad par du 'phags pa'i rdzogs pa'i byang chub la phan pa yin te /
translated: These four meditative concentrations are beneficial for the attainment of supreme enlightenment, which is perfect enlightenment that is preeminent and distinguished by the excellence of both wisdom and abandonment.

original: lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs las bzlog pa'i rim gyis bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sngon du 'gro ba bsam gtan bzhi pas bsdus pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi de ma thag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i
analyzed: lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs las bzlog pa'i rim gyis bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sngon du 'gro ba bsam gtan bzhi pas bsdus pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi de ma thag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i
translated: The vajra-like samadhi, which is included in the fourth meditation, is the cause immediately preceding perfect enlightenment, because it is preceded by the meditative attainments of the first meditation, etc., in direct and reverse order.

original: phyir ro // zag pa zad pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: phyir ro // zag pa zad pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa tsam yin te /
translated: The extinction of the contaminants is merely the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions.

original: snying brtse ba chen po'i gzhan gyi dbang gis sngon tshogs mtha' dag yongs su rdzogs pas yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa'i phyir de'i ched du mi slob po snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: snying brtse ba chen po'i gzhan gyi dbang gis sngon tshogs mtha' dag yongs su rdzogs pas yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa'i phyir de'i ched du mi slob po snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: He does not train for that purpose, thinking that he will not actualize the limit of reality, because he is motivated by great compassion and has already completed all the collections of merit in the past.

original: 'dir log par sgrub pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun tu spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir log par sgrub pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun tu spyod pa yin te /
translated: Here, wrong practice is the complete engagement in the counteragent to the perfections.

original: de yod na rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi de ma thag pa'i ngo bo mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi de ma thag pa'i ngo bo mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that exists, it is not tenable that the vajra-like samadhi is the immediate antecedent of perfect enlightenment.

original: de bsam ba'i don du shes rab phul du byung ba dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin @175b pa la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i bdag nyid rang rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bral bar ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bsam ba'i don du shes rab phul du byung ba dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin @175b pa la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i bdag nyid rang rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bral bar ston par mdzad de /
translated: which are endowed with the highest wisdom, and are complete, free from their respective resistances.

original: shes rab 'chal ba ni yul gyi gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pas le los dge ba brtsams pa thams cad la mi bzod cing mi dge ba'i bsam pa las ma lag pas dam pa'i chos dang zang zing la sogs pas gzhan la phan 'dogs par mi 'jug pa'i

translated: Because the person of faulty wisdom, being under the influence of objects, is impatient with all the virtues that are begun, and does not engage in helping others with the holy Dharma, material goods, etc.üîΩbecause of his unvirtuous thoughts.

translated: If one has that, one will attain the perfection of all the activities of the vow through infinite effort, which is the basis of one's own and others' goals. Therefore, it is called the activity of the vow, and so on.

original: ji snyed ces bya ba ni sdom pa'i bya ba sdom pa dang sems can gyi don dang dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyi bdag nyid ji snyed yod pa'o //
analyzed: ji snyed ces bya ba ni sdom pa'i bya ba sdom pa dang sems can gyi don dang dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyi bdag nyid ji snyed yod pa'o //
translated: As many as there are refers to the extent of the activity of the vow, which is the nature of the morality of the vow, the benefit of sentient beings, and the accumulation of virtuous natures.

original: rjes su 'jug ces bya ba ni srung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug ces bya ba ni srung bar byed pa'o //
translated: To engage in means to guard.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni bya ba de yang zhes bya bar skabs dang @182a * //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni bya ba de yang zhes bya bar skabs dang @182a * //
translated: And that refers to that activity, as the context requires.

original: sbyar ro ; / de lta ma yin na tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i gegs su gyur pa'i phyir 'chal pa'i tshul khrims ma rungs pa yin pas /
analyzed: sbyar ro ; / de lta ma yin na tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i gegs su gyur pa'i phyir 'chal pa'i tshul khrims ma rungs pa yin pas /
translated: Otherwise, it would be bad morality, since it would be an obstacle to attaining Buddhahood, which is the result of the perfection of morality.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says if, and so on.

original: theg pa gzhan la dga' ba ni byang chub kyi sems skyed pa'i gegs su gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: theg pa gzhan la dga' ba ni byang chub kyi sems skyed pa'i gegs su gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: The delight in other vehicles is an obstacle to the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa rnams kyi nang na tshul khrims 'chal pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa rnams kyi nang na tshul khrims 'chal pa yin no //
translated: Those are the moral faults of the wise Bodhisattvas.

original: spyod pa nyams zhes bya ba ni spyod pa nyams pa ste /
analyzed: spyod pa nyams zhes bya ba ni spyod pa nyams pa ste /
translated: The degeneration of practice is the degeneration of practice.

original: de ni de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa las 'da' ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa las 'da' ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the very reason for transgressing the Bodhisattva vow other than that.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na 'dod pa'i yon tan la gnas su zin kyang tshul khrims 'chal pa nyid ma yin pas /üîΩji ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te don go bar zad do //üîΩde ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na 'dod pa'i yon tan la gnas su zin kyang tshul khrims 'chal pa nyid ma yin pas / ji ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te don go bar zad do // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If one dedicates to complete enlightenment, then even if one is dwelling in the sense pleasures, it is not a moral fault.

original: 'di ltar chos gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If one asks, Why? he says, Because it is thus: whatever Dharma... and so on.

original: byang chub yon tan 'byung 'gyur ba //
analyzed: byang chub yon tan 'byung 'gyur ba //
translated: The perfection of giving is the perfection of giving.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang las byang chub kyi yon tan stobs la sogs pa yang dag par 'gyur par 'gyur ba'i chos de ni zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang las byang chub kyi yon tan stobs la sogs pa yang dag par 'gyur par 'gyur ba'i chos de ni zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The Dharma from which the qualities of enlightenment, the powers, etc. are generated is the meaning of morality.

original: tshul khrims don zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: tshul khrims don zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The meaning of morality is the essence of morality.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yon tan gyi 'os yin pa nyid kyi sgrib pa'i gdung ba thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur na phyis bsil bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yon tan gyi 'os yin pa nyid kyi sgrib pa'i gdung ba thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur na phyis bsil bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is the antidote to all the torments of the obscurations that prevent the attainment of the qualities of enlightenment, it is the coolness that comes later.

original: su dag gi yin zhe na /
analyzed: su dag gi yin zhe na /
translated: Whose is it?

original: yon tan chos ldan rnams kyi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yon tan chos ldan rnams kyi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said to belong to those who possess the qualities of the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas are meant.

original: de dag rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo don du gnyer ba'i phyir de rung ba'i chos kho na de dag gi tshul khrims yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo don du gnyer ba'i phyir de rung ba'i chos kho na de dag gi tshul khrims yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since they seek the essence of perfect buddhahood, only their morality is the Dharma that is suitable for that, not that of others.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: chos gang phan byed rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chos gang phan byed rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse text says, Whatever Dharma is helpful to others, and so on.

original: byang chub yongs nyams pa zhes bya ba ni chos gang la byang chub las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: byang chub yongs nyams pa zhes bya ba ni chos gang la byang chub las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase degeneration from enlightenment is to be construed as whatever Dharma is degeneration from enlightenment.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni chos 'di'o //üîΩgang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni chos 'di'o // gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: The phrase this is refers to this Dharma.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because it is so, therefore the verse text says, If one thinks, 'I will practice the perfections,' and so on.

original: 'dod yon lnga zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa chags par 'gyur ba'i yul lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dod yon lnga zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa chags par 'gyur ba'i yul lnga'o //
translated: The phrase the five sense objects refers to the five objects that cause attachment, such as form.

original: @182b spyod kyang zhes bya ba ni spyod du zin kyang ngo //
analyzed: @182b spyod kyang zhes bya ba ni spyod du zin kyang ngo //
translated: The phrase even if one practices means even if one practices.

original: sangs rgyas bsgrub bya snyam du zhes bya ba ni gal te bdag gis ji ltar na nges par sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba de ltar rab tu 'bad par bya'o snyam du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed na'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bsgrub bya snyam du zhes bya ba ni gal te bdag gis ji ltar na nges par sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba de ltar rab tu 'bad par bya'o snyam du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed na'o //
translated: The phrase thinking, 'I will attain buddhahood,' means if one thinks, I will strive in whatever way is necessary to attain buddhahood, and keeps in mind the state of omniscience.

original: tshul khrims pha rol phyin gnas zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims pha rol phyin pa la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims pha rol phyin gnas zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims pha rol phyin pa la gnas pa yin te /
translated: Abiding in the perfection of morality means abiding in the perfection of morality.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni lhag ma yin no //
translated: At that time means at the time of the remaining.

original: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro bas thog drangs pa'i rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i chos ni byang chub kyi yon tan thams cad skye bar rung ba yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //üîΩde las gzhan pa ni gal te bskal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro bas thog drangs pa'i rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i chos ni byang chub kyi yon tan thams cad skye bar rung ba yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no // de las gzhan pa ni gal te bskal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The thought is that the Dharma of generating the mind of complete enlightenment, beginning with going for refuge to the Three Jewels, is suitable for generating all the qualities of enlightenment.

original: sems bskyed de ni zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas dang dgra bcom pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed de ni zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas dang dgra bcom pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Other than that, it is said that if one generates the mind of enlightenment for the enlightenment of a pratyekabuddha or arhat,

original: de ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi byang chub las yongs su nyams pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi byang chub las yongs su nyams pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: that mind of enlightenment is the cause of falling away from the enlightenment that is the perfection of one's own and others' goals.

original: phas pham pa'i ltung ba bas kyang ches lci bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phas pham pa'i ltung ba bas kyang ches lci bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is more serious than a defeating offense.

original: phas pham pa'i ltung ba ni de ltar nyams pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: phas pham pa'i ltung ba ni de ltar nyams pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: A defeating offense is not the cause of a fall for one who has that attitude,

original: de'i bsam pa ni gtan du ltung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bsam pa ni gtan du ltung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because his attitude is not one of complete defeat.

original: ltung ba byung ba ni su yang rung ste phal cher 'di snyam du bdag gis gdon mi za bar 'khrul pa 'di kho na rtag tu ngang du gyur par bya'o snyam du ni mi sems te /
analyzed: ltung ba byung ba ni su yang rung ste phal cher 'di snyam du bdag gis gdon mi za bar 'khrul pa 'di kho na rtag tu ngang du gyur par bya'o snyam du ni mi sems te /
translated: When a downfall occurs, whoever it is, for the most part does not think, ‚ÄúI will certainly always remain in this error.‚Äù

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa kun tu spyod pa ni phung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu gcig pu yin pas mngon par dga' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa kun tu spyod pa ni phung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu gcig pu yin pas mngon par dga' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the practice of desire and so on is not something to be delighted in, since it is the sole cause of ruin.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gtan tu bya ba ma yin pas rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang lhan cig mi 'gal ba'i phyir phas pham pa'i ltung ba ni ji ltar theg pa dman pa 'dod pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gtan du bar du gcod
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gtan tu bya ba ma yin pas rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang lhan cig mi 'gal ba'i phyir phas pham pa'i ltung ba ni ji ltar theg pa dman pa 'dod pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gtan du bar du gcod
translated: Therefore, since it is not permanent, it is not contradictory to the thought of perfect enlightenment.üîΩüîΩThus, the downfall is not a downfall that is a complete rupture for bodhisattvas, as it is for those who aspire to the lesser vehicles.

original: pa'i chos ma yin no //
analyzed: pa'i chos ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is not permanent, it is not contradictory to the thought of perfect enlightenment. Thus, the downfall of a defeating offense is not a permanent obstruction for bodhisattvas, as it is for those who aspire to the lesser vehicle.

original: de ni 'jigs pa med pa'i 'bras bu gzhan don don du gnyer ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi 'bras bu chan gyi yid la byed pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //

analyzed: @183a * // de ltar na tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa'i mchog tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i dngos po la mi lta ba nyid de /

original: de yod na phyi dang nang gi dngos po yongs su gtong ba srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yod na phyi dang nang gi dngos po yongs su gtong ba srid pa'i phyir /

original: sems can dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems can dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: lta ba med pa yin zhes bya ba ni mi lta ba yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //

original: gang zag tu 'dzin pa ni de ser sna skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyi dngos pos tshul khrims kyi sbyin pa'i gags su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag tu 'dzin pa ni de ser sna skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyi dngos pos tshul khrims kyi sbyin pa'i gags su gyur pa'i phyir ro //

original: de'i gnyen po ni rang gi sems la sogs pa la bdag med pa nyid du rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni rang gi sems la sogs pa la bdag med pa nyid du rtogs pa ste /
translated: The antidote to that is the realization of selflessness in one's own mind and so on.

analyzed: des ser sna'i mtshan nyid kyi 'chal pa'i tshul khrims spangs pa tshul khrims kyi bdag nyid kyi sbyin pa yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir /

original: chos rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so /
analyzed: chos rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so /

original: bdag med ces bya ba ni rang gi bdag med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang / bdag gis byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i phyir dang / rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ni byin gyis rlob pa po'i dngos por mi 'thad pa'i phyir rtag pa yang rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag med ces bya ba ni rang gi bdag med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang / bdag gis byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i phyir dang / rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ni byin gyis rlob pa po'i dngos por mi 'thad pa'i phyir rtag pa yang rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Since they are selfless, they are not the self of persons, since they lack the nature of self, and they are not the self of phenomena, since they are not empowered by a self, and they are not a permanent self, since they are not a cause, as it is untenable that they are the entity of an empowerer. üîΩSince they are not a cause, they are not a permanent self, as it is untenable that they are the entity of an empowerer.

original: ji skad sngar bshad pa lta bu'o snyam du dgongs pa yin no /
analyzed: ji skad sngar bshad pa lta bu'o snyam du dgongs pa yin no /
translated: As it is said earlier, they are not a cause.

original: ya ma brla zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa'o //

translated: The ‚Äúuncertain‚Äù is the one that is dependent on the other, the cause.

original: de ni gnas med do zhes bya ba ni sems can du lta ba na ser sna'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin na de med pas de yang mi srid do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnas med do zhes bya ba ni sems can du lta ba na ser sna'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin na de med pas de yang mi srid do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is not possible‚Äù means that if the view of sentient beings as real is the chief cause of stinginess, then that being is not possible because of the absence of that.

original: gang dag la bdag tu 'du shes pa yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di skad du bdag tu 'dzin pa yod na bdag la chags pa'i phyir rang gi bde ba sgrub pa'i dngos po la bdag gi nyid 'dzin cing de las kyang de la chags
analyzed: gang dag la bdag tu 'du shes pa yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di skad du bdag tu 'dzin pa yod na bdag la chags pa'i phyir rang gi bde ba sgrub pa'i dngos po la bdag gi nyid 'dzin cing de las kyang de la chags
translated: ‚ÄúThose who have the notion of self‚Äù and so on means that if there is the grasping of self, then because of attachment to self, one grasps as ‚Äúmine‚Äù the things that are the means of accomplishing one‚Äôs own happiness. And because of that, attachment arises.

original: pa'i 'dod chags 'byung bas sems rmongs pa de dag la gtong ba'i blo gtan du ba lta ga la yod de /
analyzed: pa'i 'dod chags 'byung bas sems rmongs pa de dag la gtong ba'i blo gtan du ba lta ga la yod de /
translated: How could those whose minds are confused have the thought of giving that is permanent?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs stobs dang ldan pas de shin tu zil gyis gnon pa'i @184a * //üîΩphyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs stobs dang ldan pas de shin tu zil gyis gnon pa'i @184a * //üîΩphyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Because the opposing side is powerful, it completely overwhelms that thought.

original: ser sna'i skyon ma mthong ba ni de yod na slong bar byed pa la sogs pa log par sgrub pa la mi bzod pas ser sna 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ser sna'i skyon ma mthong ba ni de yod na slong bar byed pa la sogs pa log par sgrub pa la mi bzod pas ser sna 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Not seeing the fault of stinginess is the arising of stinginess because one is intolerant of the wrong practice of begging, etc. when it exists.

original: de'i gnyen po ni ser sna mi mthun pa yin par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni ser sna mi mthun pa yin par rtogs pa ste /
translated: The antidote to that is the realization that is incompatible with stinginess.

original: des slong bar byed pa thams cad la dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin par 'du shes shing ser sna dang bral bas bzod pa'i yan lag gi gtong ba yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir /

translated: Because of that, one has the perception that all beggars are spiritual friends, and because of being free from stinginess, one accomplishes the limb of patience of giving.

original: ser sna can ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ser sna can ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThe stingy person,‚Äù and so on.

analyzed: ser sna can ni zhes bya ba ni ser sna dang ldan pa ni zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: yo byad la sogs pa la chad pa'i rnam par smin pa la sogs ni yi dvags kyi 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dbus por 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result that is similar to the cause is stated in the line, ‚Äúhe becomes poor.

analyzed: shes nas zhes bya ba ni de ltar ser sna'i nyes pas mi dang yi dvags kyi 'gro ba dag na sems can dbul por gyur pa dag shes nas so //

analyzed: gtong ba la mos par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i sgo nas te /

analyzed: lhug par gtong zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'i sgo nas te ;

analyzed: gnod pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi gags su mi 'gyur ba'i gtong ba'i bsam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir gling bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: theg pa gzhan du yongs su bsngo ba ni de rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi dbang du byas pa'i brtson 'grus chen po phul du byung ba dang ldan pa'i gtong ba'i bsam pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'di byin par gyur @184b cig snyam du zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa 'dis srid pa gsum du gtogs pa'i sems can ji snyed pa de dag gi phun sum tshogs pa kha na ma tho ba med pa rnams 'byor par gyur cig snyam du bsams nas zhes bya
translated: The phrase may this be given means that one should think, May the wealth of all sentient beings included in the three realms be prosperous and free from misfortune through this giving.

original: ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ba'i tha tshig go //

original: de nas ci byed ce na /
analyzed: de nas ci byed ce na /
translated: What does one do after that?üîΩThe text states,
