original: de ni longs spyod la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i rjes su yi rang bas kyang 'gro ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs zil gyis gnon par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni longs spyod la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i rjes su yi rang bas kyang 'gro ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs zil gyis gnon par 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning is that even a great mass of the finest jewels is overwhelmed by a single jewel of beryl, because it is the cause of the perfection of wealth, etc. In the same way, even the mass of merit of beings is overwhelmed by the rejoicing of a bodhisattva, because it is the cause of the perfection of the qualities of a buddha.

original: de ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no /
analyzed: de ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no /
translated: because it is the cause of the perfection of one's own and others' goals.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid la phyin ci log pa ni /
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid la phyin ci log pa ni /
translated: The error regarding the characteristics of dharmas

original: de phyin ci ma log pa'i bdag nyid kyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de phyin ci ma log pa'i bdag nyid kyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is the resistance to the perfection of giving, because it is the opposite of the nature of that.

original: de'i gnyen po ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pa ste /
translated: The antidote to that is the realization that all dharmas are emptiness.

original: des bstangs pas sbyin pa zag pa med pa'i tshogs 'phel ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyin /
analyzed: des bstangs pas sbyin pa zag pa med pa'i tshogs 'phel ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyin /
translated: Because it is nourished by that, giving becomes the cause of the increase of the undefiled collection.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If one does not make it one's own, etc.

original: de la bdag gir mi byed ces bya ba ni gal te chos thams cad bdag med par rtogs pa'i phyir de la bdag gi nyid du mi byed na'o //
analyzed: de la bdag gir mi byed ces bya ba ni gal te chos thams cad bdag med par rtogs pa'i phyir de la bdag gi nyid du mi byed na'o //
translated: There, one does not make it one's own means if one does not make it one's own because one realizes that all dharmas are selfless.

original: dngos po phangs med ces bya ba ni phangs pa ni bdag gir mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i @185b phyir de med na de mi srid do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po phangs med ces bya ba ni phangs pa ni bdag gir mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i @185b phyir de med na de mi srid do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase without regard for material things means that when there is no regard for material things, there is no regard for the self, because the latter is preceded by the former.

original: dge ba'i chos kho na zag pa med pa nyid kyis sgrib pa thams cad spong ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyin mthu chen te de byang chub sems dpa' gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //üîΩsprin med 'od ldan zla dkyil yar gyi ngo bzhin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos kho na zag pa med pa nyid kyis sgrib pa thams cad spong ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyin mthu chen te de byang chub sems dpa' gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o // sprin med 'od ldan zla dkyil yar gyi ngo bzhin no //
translated: The word great means that only the wholesome factors are the cause for the elimination of all obscurations through their incorruptibility. The bodhisattva who possesses this is called one who is great.

original: zhes bya ba ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gang la sprin med pa'i 'od zer yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gang la sprin med pa'i 'od zer yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o /
translated: The phrase like the full moon free of clouds means that the moon is called free of clouds when it is free of clouds.

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba bshad zin to /
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba bshad zin to /
translated: The divisions of the realization of the summit have been explained.

original: // mthar gyis pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // mthar gyis pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now the gradual type will be discussed.

original: de ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis bdag med kyang 'jig rten mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis bdag med kyang 'jig rten mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that this is the characteristic of the stages of engagement in the perfection of generosity and so on, which are by nature devoid of a self of phenomena, in order to abandon worldly attachment.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ji ltar na chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthar gyis bgyid pa dag gda' lags sam zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ji ltar na chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthar gyis bgyid pa dag gda' lags sam zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, how is it that for bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas, in the nature of all phenomena that are not entities, there are gradual activities?

original: gal te bdag byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyang rung 'on te bdag mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te bdag byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyang rung 'on te bdag mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyang rung ste /
translated: If I fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening or if I do not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa kho na yin mod kyi ma la bdag gis gang zhig mngon par rdzogs pa sangs rgyas nas sems can dngos po'i 'du shes la spyod pa thams cad dngos po med pa la dgod par 'gyur ba bla na med pa yangüîΩdag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya gor ma chag go snyam du zhes bya ba'i bar dang / sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste bdag nyid kyang sbyin pa byin zhing gzhan dag kyang sbyin pa la so sor dgod par byed do zhes bya ba'i bra gang rgyas par 'byung ba yin no /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa kho na yin mod kyi ma la bdag gis gang zhig mngon par rdzogs pa sangs rgyas nas sems can dngos po'i 'du shes la spyod pa thams cad dngos po med pa la dgod par 'gyur ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya gor ma chag go snyam du zhes bya ba'i bar dang / sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste bdag nyid kyang sbyin pa byin zhing gzhan dag kyang sbyin pa la so sor dgod par byed do zhes bya ba'i bra gang rgyas par 'byung ba yin no /
translated: Although all phenomena are indeed just nonthings, I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment and then establish all sentient beings who engage in the idea of things in nonthings.üîΩFrom the time of generating the first thought of enlightenment, I will give gifts myself and establish others in giving gifts.

original: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mthar gyis pa rtogs pa ni zas la sogs pa sbyin pa la goms pas bdag dang gzhan yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mthar gyis pa rtogs pa ni zas la sogs pa sbyin pa la goms pas bdag dang gzhan yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ;
translated: The perfection of giving that is realized in stages is the perfection of giving that is realized in stages because it ripens oneself and others through being accustomed to giving food and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva, etc.

original: yi dvags 'gro ba gcod ces bya ba ni sbyor ba'i gnas skabs kho na na rang gi nor la sogs pa la 'dzin pa med pa nyid kyis yi dvags kyi 'gro ba spangs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdbul ba gcod ces bya ba ni 'gro ba @186a * //
analyzed: yi dvags 'gro ba gcod ces bya ba ni sbyor ba'i gnas skabs kho na na rang gi nor la sogs pa la 'dzin pa med pa nyid kyis yi dvags kyi 'gro ba spangs pa'i phyir ro // dbul ba gcod ces bya ba ni 'gro ba @186a * //
translated: Cutter-off of the destiny of ghosts means that at the time of preparation, by the very fact of non-attachment to his own wealth, etc., he abandons the destiny of ghosts.

original: thams cad du tshegs med par yo byad phun sum tshogs pa rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du tshegs med par yo byad phun sum tshogs pa rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Cutter-off of poverty means that in all destinies he obtains the perfection of resources without difficulty.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad gcod ces bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad gcod ces bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: Cutter-off of all afflictions is to be supplied.

original: 'khor gsum mi dmigs pa khong na yod pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs na nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor gsum mi dmigs pa khong na yod pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs na nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the cultivation of the perfection of generosity which is based on the non-apprehension of the three spheres, at the time of the path of insight, he abandons all the obstructions of the afflictions.

original: spyod tshe zhes bya ba ni sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa la 'jug pa na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyod tshe zhes bya ba ni sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa la 'jug pa na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the course of conduct means when he enters the stages of joy, etc.

original: longs spyod ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi bdag po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: longs spyod ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi bdag po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Enjoyment is the characteristic of being the lord of Jambudvipa, etc.

original: mtha' yas pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'dren par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'dren par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is infinite because it is the cause of the attainment of non-abiding nirvana.

original: rgyas pa ni rnam pa mang ba'i phyir dang sems can thams cad kyi gsos su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyas pa ni rnam pa mang ba'i phyir dang sems can thams cad kyi gsos su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is extensive because it is manifold and because it is the nourishment of all sentient beings.

original: sdug bsngal gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The suffering of the world is twofold:

original: rgyu'i sdug bsngal gyis ni ser sna la sogs pa'i nyes pas nye bar bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i sdug bsngal gyis ni ser sna la sogs pa'i nyes pas nye bar bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the suffering of the cause, because it is destroyed by the faults of stinginess, etc.

original: 'bras bu'i sdug bsngal gyis ni dbul ba la sogs pas gtses pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i sdug bsngal gyis ni dbul ba la sogs pas gtses pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the suffering of the result, because it is afflicted by poverty, etc.

original: yongs su smin byed ces bya ba ni yongs su smin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su smin byed ces bya ba ni yongs su smin par byed pa ste /
translated: It is the ripening of the result, because it is the cause of the ripening of the result.

original: skyon dang yon tan bri zhing 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir zang zing la sogs pas kun du bsdus nas pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos sbyin pas rung ba nyid du byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyon dang yon tan bri zhing 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir zang zing la sogs pas kun du bsdus nas pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos sbyin pas rung ba nyid du byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In order to diminish faults and increase virtues, he attracts them with material things, etc., and makes them suitable by giving the Dharma of the perfections. This is the meaning.

original: sbyin pas rang gi longs spyod la 'dzin pa spangs nas /
analyzed: sbyin pas rang gi longs spyod la 'dzin pa spangs nas /
translated: By giving, he abandons attachment to his own resources.

original: khrims kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khrims kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: By morality, etc., he attracts them.

original: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa ni ngan 'gro thams cad dang 'gal ba'i phyir dud 'gro smos pa ni nye bar mtshon par zad do //
analyzed: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa ni ngan 'gro thams cad dang 'gal ba'i phyir dud 'gro smos pa ni nye bar mtshon par zad do //
translated: The perfection of morality is mentioned because it is the antidote to all unfortunate states of existence. The mention of animal birth is merely an illustration.

original: mi khom brgyad ni ngan song du skye ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mi khom brgyad ni ngan song du skye ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The eight inopportune states of existence are birth in unfortunate states of existence, etc.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don la 'jug par rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir de dag kyang spong ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don la 'jug par rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir de dag kyang spong ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: They are also to be abandoned because they are not suitable for engaging in the benefit of self and other.

original: de las bzlog pa ni ngal ba ste de dag rnyed do //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni ngal ba ste de dag rnyed do //
translated: The opposite of that is ease, and he obtains that.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du ste /
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du ste /
translated: Always means at all times.

original: sbyor ba'i gnas skabs nas bzung ste rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la thug gi bar du mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims kyis rang dang gzhan la phan pa'i lus sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i gnas skabs nas bzung ste rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la thug gi bar du mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims kyis rang dang gzhan la phan pa'i lus sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From the stage of preparation up to the vajra like concentration, morality endowed with nonapprehension accomplishes the body that benefits oneself and others.

original: de ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sdig pa'i bsam pa las rnam par log pa ni bzod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa @186b smos so //
analyzed: de ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sdig pa'i bsam pa las rnam par log pa ni bzod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa @186b smos so //
translated: Thus, having turned away from sinful thoughts by means of the perfection of morality, one should practice patience, etc.

original: dam pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi nyes pa'i rten ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: dam pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi nyes pa'i rten ma yin pa ste /
translated: The best means not being a basis for the faults of oneself and others.

original: chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pas de kho na nyid kyi ye shes dang mthun pa'i gzugs thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pas de kho na nyid kyi ye shes dang mthun pa'i gzugs thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the patience that is the discernment of reality, one obtains the form that is in conformity with the intuition of reality.

original: rgya chen ni sprul pa 'od zer 'phro ba phun sum tshogs pa dpe med pa yin te /
analyzed: rgya chen ni sprul pa 'od zer 'phro ba phun sum tshogs pa dpe med pa yin te /
translated: Vast means the perfection of the emanation of light rays, which is incomparable.

original: sems can gyi don sgrub pa dag la sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa lhun gyis grub par 'gro ba la phan 'dogs nus pa'i sku 'grub pa pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don sgrub pa dag la sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa lhun gyis grub par 'gro ba la phan 'dogs nus pa'i sku 'grub pa pa'i phyir ro //
translated: benefit beings is accomplished.

original: gser mdog ces bya ba ni mdog gser ltar dang pa'o //
analyzed: gser mdog ces bya ba ni mdog gser ltar dang pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGolden complexion‚Äù means a complexion like gold.

original: blta ba'i 'os zhes bya ba ni blta na sdug pa ste /
analyzed: blta ba'i 'os zhes bya ba ni blta na sdug pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWorthy of being seen‚Äù means beautiful to behold.üîΩThe patience of accepting the harm done by others is the cause of being

original: gzhan gyi gnod pa byas pa dang du len pa'i bzod pa ni gzhan gyi snying du sdug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gnod pa byas pa dang du len pa'i bzod pa ni gzhan gyi snying du sdug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: dear to others.

original: de ltar bzod pa dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar bzod pa dang ldan pa ni /
translated: Thus, one who is endowed with patience

original: brtson 'grus kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: is endowed with effort, as it is said.

original: dkar po'i yon tan ni zag pa med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o /
analyzed: dkar po'i yon tan ni zag pa med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o /
translated: The good qualities are the uncontaminated perfections, and so on.

original: de dag 'grib mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yang dag par spong ba'i gnas skabs na dri ma med pa'i ye shes kyi 'os su rung ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag 'grib mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yang dag par spong ba'i gnas skabs na dri ma med pa'i ye shes kyi 'os su rung ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThey do not diminish‚Äù means that in the context of the correct abandonings, one attains the state of being fit for stainless wisdom.

original: ye shes mtha' yas zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: ye shes mtha' yas zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bdag nyid de /
translated: The infinite intuition is the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.

original: de ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba'i sa 'od 'phro ba can du 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba'i sa 'od 'phro ba can du 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the radiant stage, because it is distinguished by the purification of the perfection of metidiation.

original: rgyal ba'i bong ba ni stobs bcu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i bong ba ni stobs bcu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The treasure of the victors is the ten powers, etc.

original: de'i mdzod ni gnas te /
analyzed: de'i mdzod ni gnas te /
translated: Its store is the abode.

original: ye shes gang yin pa de yang sangs rgyas nyid kyi gnas skabs na rnyed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ye shes gang yin pa de yang sangs rgyas nyid kyi gnas skabs na rnyed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The intuition that is there is attained in the state of buddhahood.

original: de ltar dge ba la spro ba phun sum tshogs pa rnyed pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar dge ba la spro ba phun sum tshogs pa rnyed pa ni /
translated: Thus, having attained the perfection of enthusiasm for virtue,

original: bsam gtan gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, by means of meditation, etc.

original: smad pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan smad par bya ba dag 'dor zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: smad pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan smad par bya ba dag 'dor zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The disdain is the disdain for the sense objects. He casts off is to be supplied.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang la gnas pa bsam gtan la brten nas yul dag la chags pa sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang la gnas pa bsam gtan la brten nas yul dag la chags pa sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The bases of psychic power are established in the concentrations, and on that basis, one eliminates attachment to objects.

original: rig pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: rig pa ni gsum ste /
translated: Knowledge is threefold:

original: lha'i mig dang sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i mig dang sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of the divine eye, the knowledge of the recollection of past lives, and the knowledge of the extinction of the contaminants.

original: mngon par shes pa ni drag ste gsum po de dag dang / lha'i rna ba dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa'o //üîΩde dag mngon par bsgrub pa ni sa lnga pa la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin @187a * //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa ni drag ste gsum po de dag dang / lha'i rna ba dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa'o // de dag mngon par bsgrub pa ni sa lnga pa la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin @187a * //
translated: The superknowledges are six: those three, plus the divine ear, psychic power, and the knowledge of others' minds.

original: pa rnam par dag pas rim gyis mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mchog tu gyur pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa rnam par dag pas rim gyis mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mchog tu gyur pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Their realization is on the fifth ground, because on the ground of the cloud of Dharma, one attains the supreme qualities of the superknowledges, etc., through the purification of the perfection of meditative stabilization.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The meditative stabilizations are the heroic stride, etc.

original: de yang gnas skabs gong ma gong ma dag tu mngon par sgrub bo zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang gnas skabs gong ma gong ma dag tu mngon par sgrub bo zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: They are also realized on the higher and higher stages.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes par 'gyur bas shes rab kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes par 'gyur bas shes rab kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The line through wisdom and so on is stated because one will come to know reality just as it is through meditative equipoise.

original: dbang po dang stobs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i shes rab kyis so //üîΩchos kyi rang bzhin yongs shes nas //
